definitions.definition: To lose one’s traction on a slippery surface; to slide due to a lack of friction .
To accidentally reveal a secret or otherwise say something unintentionally.
To move or fly (out of place); to shoot; often with out , off , etc.
examples: A bone may slip out of place.

definitions.definition: To elude or evade by smooth movement.
examples: I caught the thief, but he slipped my grasp and ran away.

definitions.definition: To pass (a note, money, etc. ), often covertly .
examples: She thanked the porter and slipped a ten-dollar bill into his hand.

definitions.definition: To cause to move smoothly and quickly; to slide; to convey gently or secretly.
To move quickly and often secretively ; to depart, withdraw, enter, appear, intrude, or escape as if by sliding.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To lose one’s traction on a slippery surface; to slide due to a lack of friction .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To accidentally reveal a secret or otherwise say something unintentionally.
( intransitive ) To move or fly (out of place); to shoot; often with out , off , etc.
( transitive ) To elude or evade by smooth movement.
( transitive ) To pass (a note, money, etc. ), often covertly .
( transitive ) To cause to move smoothly and quickly; to slide; to convey gently or secretly.
( intransitive ) To move quickly and often secretively ; to depart, withdraw, enter, appear, intrude, or escape as if by sliding.
